intro: Navarretia furnissii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada lily, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short flowering stem. Navarretia furnissii is often found in the Sierra Nevada mountain range and is adapted to the region's cool, wet climate.
